subject: Politics
title: Power and Wealth
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Power and Wealth.

hook.text: In the US, the top 1% donate more to campaigns than the bottom 75% combined. Money doesn't just talk â€” it governs.

buildup.text: Wealth translates into political power through donations, lobbying, media ownership, and access to decision-makers.

discovery.text: Studies show that US policy aligns with wealthy preferences. Average citizens' views have near-zero impact on outcomes.

twist.text: It's not just bribery. Wealthy people shape the agenda by funding think tanks, universities, and media outlets.

climax.text: Economic inequality becomes political inequality. When money buys influence, democracy serves the rich first.

punchline.text: Money is the universal political currency. Those with most of it make the rules.

quiz.question: How does wealth translate into political power?
options: Through donations, lobbying, media ownership, and access to decision-makers
Wealthy people have no more influence than average citizens
Only through direct bribery of politicians
